intro: Hieracium amischum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in rocky and well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium amischum is often found in open areas such as meadows and slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
